'Chloral', also known as 'trichloroacetaldehyde', is the organic compound with
the formula Cl 3CCHO. This aldehyde is a colourless oily liquid that
is soluble in a wide range of solvents. It reacts with water to form chloral
hydrate, a once widely used sedative and hypnotic substance.
